channel.title: What's wrong with my class?

item.title: What's wrong with my class?
item.dc:creator: @jaruanna jaruanna
item.description:
@jaruanna wrote:

Hey guys, I am making a cooking class. So far I have been doing pretty well but I ran into a problem. I had to turn my arrays into ints(if you know what I am trying to say) and so I did a for loop. But when I apply it in a method, it doesn’t work. For a test, I wanted it so when I used an item on object, it would send out (“hello!”); But it wouldn’t work… here is my cooking.java:

[code]package server.skills;
import server.client;
public class Cooking {

    static int cookingRange = 883;
    static int rawFood[] = {317, 321, 327, 331, 335, 338, 341, 345, 349, 353,
                               359, 363, 371, 377, 383, 389, 395};
    static int cookOn[] = {114, 2728, 2729, 2730, 2731, 2732, 3038, 3769,
                                   4266, 5499, 11404, 11405, 11406};

public static void itemOnObject(server.packetHandler.Packets p, client c, int ItemID, int UsedOnObjectID) {
for(int food = 0; food < rawFood.length; food++) {
for(int cookingOn = 0; cookingOn < cookOn.length; cookingOn++) {
if((ItemID == food) && (UsedOnObjectID == cookingOn)) {
c.sM(“Hello”);
return;
}
}

    	}
}

}[/code]

How to fix?

Read full topic
